Today is Earth Day!

Our National Parks provide an escape both mentally and physically from our everyday lives but we all must do our part to protect these national treasures.

What are you doing to help preserve and protect our home this Earth Day and everyday?

It's also #NationalParkWeek! Get involved on social media and share your passion for our National Parks (and don't forget to tag us in your posts).

Learn more on how the National Park Service is celebrating Earth Day and the things they are doing to protect our parks, as well as what you can do to help.

Read More Here

Do you like the content we create at Discover Our Parks? Help us keep it going. Whether you become a subscriber by donating on a monthly basis or you make a one-time donation, your support helps us add new features to make our site your go to place for trip planning. It's super easy. Find out how you can help.

Learn how you can support us
 

Discovering the beauty of our April 2021 - Park of the Month is an amazing experience. From beautiful hikes into the lower canyons to learning how water & wind can change and transform the landscape, this park has something for everyone!

Learn more about this fascinating park with recommendations on the best hikes, campgrounds and other activities to enjoy, in the article.

Read More Here

Coming this May...

Discover Our Parks' website will be getting an update. With new menu design, easier to find information, park and campground ratings, and much more! We'll also begin adding all the other National Park Service sites to help you discover even more amazing places to visit and stay.

Learn more about this upcoming "facelift" and how you can get an early peak when the time comes.

Learn More Here

Also beginning in May and throughout the summer, State Parks will start dropping on the site!

With over 3,729 state parks, planning trips and finding all the places to visit and stay will be much easier.

Make sure you take our State Parks poll now because this determines the order the parks will become available on our site. And don't forget to become a Patreon supporter for more updates and early access to the State Parks.

Take the Poll

More Park News

Self-Driving Vehicles Coming To Yellowstone, Wright Brothers National Memorial

You'll want to watch for driverless vehicles in Yellowstone National Park and Wright Brothers National Memorial, and possibly other parks, this year as the National Park Service tests the autonomous vehicles.

THIS ARTICLE IS FROM:
Read more here

Jogger Tells Grand Teton National Park Black Bear "I'm Not Your Food."

A jogger out for a run in Grand Teton National Park last week resorted to an unusual defense when he encountered a black bear, shouting out that "I'm not your food."

THIS ARTICLE IS FROM:
Read more here

Chisos Basin in Big Bend National Park to Reopen Friday, April 23 after the 1341 acre South Rim Fire

With the 1341 acre South Rim Fire at 80% containment and no longer deemed a threat to developed areas, the NPS has scheduled the reopening of the park’s popular Chisos Basin area on Friday, April 23rd at 11:00 AM.

Read more here

Covid Proving Costly To The National Park Service

Science, interpretation, and resource management are among the areas in the National Park System that have taken hits from the coronavirus pandemic, according to a study of how park operations across the country were affected by Covid-19.

THIS ARTICLE IS FROM:
Read more here

Alsek River Mouth Predicted to Shift 20 Miles South of Current Location in Glacier Bay National Park

On March 17, a peer-reviewed article in the scientific journal Geomorphology announced the results of research predicting that the Alsek River mouth is likely to shift 20 miles south from its current location in Glacier Bay National Preserve and possibly exit elsewhere from the park into the Gulf of Alaska.

Read more here
